body_html:
The code all looks good. Looks like there's something wrong with build script since Runtime.cpp is sometimes compiled even when MKLDNN isn't available.

It looks like you're threading WITH_MKLDNN from setup.py through to the ATen CMakeLists.txt. Can this all live in the ATen's CMakeLists.txt instead? I'm not sure anything in torch/csrc needs MKLDNN (except through ATen). I know some of the other libraries (like cuDNN) are not built this way, but that's because we were using them directly in torch/csrc (prior to ATen).

body:
The code all looks good. Looks like there's something wrong with build script since `Runtime.cpp` is sometimes compiled even when MKLDNN isn't available.

It looks like you're threading `WITH_MKLDNN` from `setup.py` through to the ATen `CMakeLists.txt`. Can this all live in the ATen's `CMakeLists.txt` instead? I'm not sure anything in `torch/csrc` needs MKLDNN (except through ATen). I know some of the other libraries (like cuDNN) are not built this way, but that's because we were using them directly in `torch/csrc` (prior to ATen).
